intro: Diplotaxis acris, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it produces yellow flowers with a distinctive black center. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Diplotaxis acris is also known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
